titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1828 Oct. 25: a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1828 Oct. 25
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This document is an excerpt from the court from Saturday October 25, 1828 to Tuesday October 28. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.head: October Term 1828
Saturday 25th
div1.p: The court met according to adjournment
Present Andrew Ross, John Huss and Walter S. Adair. Judges
The Court adjourned to monday 10 OClock A.M.
Court convened according to adjournment Present the honorable Judges. monday Octo 27
The Court met according to adjournment Present the honorable Judges 28th.

William Berry
by his Agent
James Gibson
vs
William Lastley
To recover the price of a horse
The Court finds a bill for the Pltf. the sum of one hundred & fifteen dollars

Stay taken on the above Judgement according to Law
Andrew Ross
James Lasley x his mark

Witness
Elijah Hicks
clk, S. C
The principle paid by Wm. Lastley July 13 1829 Execution issued 20th August 1829 for the cost
